etymology.description: Depicts a window with an open lattice pattern
etymology.interpretation: The character 囧(jǒng, "window") originally represents a window with an open lattice design, illustrating its functional purpose as a framework for ventilation and light.

examples.chinese: 这扇囧很大(這扇囧很大)。
早晨透过囧射进温暖的光(早晨透過囧射進溫暖的光)，一切焕然一新(一切煥然一新)。
examples.pinyin: Zǎochén tòuguò jiǒng shè jìn wēnnuǎn de guāng, yīqiè huànrán yīxīn.
examples.english: In the morning, warm light poured in through the window, and everything looked brand new.

examples.chinese: 老屋的囧保存着历史的痕迹(老屋的囧保存著歷史的痕跡)，诉说着往昔的故事(訴說著往昔的故事)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎowū de jiǒng bǎocún zhe lìshǐ de hénjì, sùshuō zhe wǎngxī de gùshì.
examples.english: The old house's window preserves traces of history and tells stories of the past.
